intro: Symplocos unicarpa, commonly known as the one-fruited wax myrtle, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green on top. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. The fruit is a single-seeded capsule that turns red when mature, adding to its ornamental value.
